title: Syncronisation and loss of passwords
content: I sync settings/info etc between two devices - an Asus Windows 10 laptop (Firefox 108.0.1 64-bit) and an iPhone6 (Firefox 108.1 (24234). A week or so ago I notice that sync was not happening and when I tried to access my Firefox account found that the password was not accepted - even though it was securely stored on the iPhone "passwords" list. I had to create a new Firefox password, however, all my other internet passwords that were stored on Firefox have been lost. It is possible for these to be restored? Many thanks Graham
creator: graham3443

“MozillaVPN.msi” is an executable file. Executable files may contain viruses or other malicious code that could harm your computer. Use caution when opening this file. Are you sure you want to launch “MozillaVPN.msi” ?

title: Some secure log-ins bounce me back to the main landing page of the site
content:
Hello,

I am running a Microsoft Surface running Windows 10. I think there was a system update yesterday. Since then, there are some sites that when I log in to my account, I get part of the way there, but I get bounced back to the main landing page of the site without logging in.

I am able to get logged in using Microsoft Edge or if I use Firefox on an iPad. Just not on the Surface.

Is there something in Firefox that isn't playing well with the recent update to Windows 10? Any idea if there's anything I can do other than use a different browser?
creator: taratoot

title: Bookmarks have been taken over by Facebook
content: Recently I opened a video posted on one of my Facebook pages. A dialogue box came up saying that my computer had been infected by a trogan and to contact Microsoft to rectify the problem,. I immediately shut down my computer and waited for about 10 minutes On rebooting I scanned my computer with my installed apps Superspyware and Total Internet Security but neither of them advised me that a there was a trogan infection. However since that time my bookmarks have been taken over by FB paged who I subscribe to and don't allow me to access the original bookmarked URL Please give me guidance how I can rectify this situation
creator: Greyhairedbloke43

title: Firefox (desktop and android) unable to load google-related sites (gmail and google search)
content:
Essentially, Firefox (desktop and android) at random times fail to fully load google websites. For instance if I search in the toolbar (google is the default) it won't complete the search, it will just think a bit then revert to a 'new tab' page as if the search never existed (bing.com works fine). Or if I go to my gmail account, it'll slowly load the envelope loading screen but will never complete. This is an intermittent issue throughout the day/night where suddenly I just can't load gmail or google search for 20 or so minutes.

I am able to get to google photos and calendar, etc. but not gmail or google search.

I am able to load those in other browsers such as Edge. I have attempted to clear cache and history and turned off all of my extensions. I've also re-installed Firefox.

The closest thing I have to a solution is that it has something to do with my home internet (wifi not hardwired) and/or region (Australia). For example, when the sites don't load I've tested turning on a VPN for the US, which then allows the sites to load just fine.

Is this some sort of DNS issue or something that I can change in the router or on my desktop? It's very curious that it's only those two sites that don't work (gmail and google search).
creator: StaghAus

title: after upgrading to 108, tabs disappeared
content: after upgrading to 108 all my tabs disappeared... tab bar was done, with no way to get to the tabs. I can't believe such a critical issue wasn't caught and again, a huge pain to downgrade with forcing users to create a new profile. I found an article online to update something in about:config to get tabs back, but hoping for a legitimate patch to be released.

title: can't access synced data
content:
I recently upgraded to Windows 11, and was very careful, I thought, to back up my Firefox bookmarks and the tab plugin I use to save my sessions because for whatever reason Firefox can't handle that reliably. It all worked, because I could just sync it, but now a month later I had to reinstall Windows and... I can't sync my browser.

I've tried every password I could think of. I can't recall if I wrote it down somewhere last time, or changed it since, but I'm pretty sure I'm using the right email. Right now I'm logged in with another account.

And while I see a tab session saved from last month, which is unfortunately a little out of date but better than nothing, I don't see any saved bookmarks from this year. Just one from a year ago. I have no idea what's happened exactly, but I wasn't as careful this time because the sync worked so recently.

Now I'm stuck! I have some very important bookmark folders saved, that are key to all my projects basically. I can't just start fresh. But I can't log in, can't find any password change written down in my notes, which I may just have forgotten to note down. And I can't find any contact for Firefox support.

I do value security when it comes to handling my data but there must be a way to verify who I am, and change the password using my email?
creator: pk3
